creator: bedal@mw.narzan.com
text:
Using ant to run rather big project (total volume of ant files >400k) I 
inevitably get 'out of memory' or just 'exception in thread Main' messages. 

Usually this happens not far from the end of the whole build process 
running 'jar' task. That jar may be a little and that task being started alone 
works ok.

I gave to Java a lot of memory: -Xmx256m -Xms64m -Xss96m , total of 1266 Mb of 
memory was use× - nothing changed :-(

I've changed ant version from 1.4 to 1.4.1 without success.

I tried newest nightly ant's build (2002.03.24) and got fine result - all 
bothering exception run away. Thank you. 

But now i have doubts: are there any known difficulties I must be aware with 
these new builds?
creator: bedal@mw.narzan.com

text:
Thanks for reporting success.

The only things to be aware of with nightly builds are:

1) Not all optional tasks are built into them.
2) Syntax and features are subject to change between releases.
3) Stability should not be much of a concern - Gump's multiple-per-day sweeps 
of builds using the latest builds of Ant each time ensures that its building 
many projects successfully.
